title: Ticket #5194: don't append trailing whitespace after CMD in condor_q output
description:
In condor_q, the "%-18.18s" and "(%-17.17s)" format specifiers for the CMD field in the output include trailing whitespace if the CMD is less than 18 or 17 characters long. Changing them to "%.18s" and "(%.17s)" would still be left justified and would truncate at the desired max length, but would avoid the trailing whitespace.

My motivation? Adding up the width specifiers in these printf format strings shows that the output was intended to fit into 78 columns. Unfortunately, in the CHTC and probably other places, the cluster number (and others) are bigger (ie, wider) than the given field's width specifier, and so on an 80-column terminal (my default), output lines wrap due only to the trailing whitespace.
